pageTitle: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau speaks with British Columbia Premier John Horgan | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Prime Minister Justin Trudeau spoke with British Columbia Premier John Horgan today to discuss the COVID-19 situation. They reviewed the steps taken by the governments of British Columbia and Canada in recent months to protect the health and safety of Canadians and to support workers and businesses.  This includes the recent announcement of the $2 billion Safe Return to Class Fund. This fund will provide up to $242.36 million to British Columbia to support its efforts for a safe return to school and to protect the health of students and staff.

The Prime Minister and Premier Horgan also discussed other shared priorities, including opioids, housing, infrastructure, and fair trade with the U.S. for softwood lumber and aluminum.

The Prime Minister thanked Premier Horgan for his important contributions to the 17 First Ministersâ€™ discussions held since the outset of the pandemic. They agreed to remain in touch and to continue to work closely together on the response to COVID-19 and on economic recovery.
